snap.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: to break with a sudden sharp noise, or to make something do this
snap.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: A twig snapped under my feet.
The wind snapped branches and power lines.
The teacher snapped the chalk in two and gave me a piece.
I snapped the ends off the beans and dropped them into a bowl.
snap.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: to move into a particular position suddenly, making a short sharp noise, or to make something move like this
snap.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: The pieces just snap together like this.
The policeman snapped the handcuffs around her wrist.
snap.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: to say something quickly in an angry way
snap.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: He snapped at Walter for no reason.
snap.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: to suddenly stop being able to control your anger, anxiety, or other feelings in a difficult situation
snap.translation[0].definitions[3].examp: The stress began to get to her, and one morning she just snapped.
Something inside him snapped, and he hit her.
snap.translation[0].definitions[4].defin: if an animal such as a dog snaps, it tries to bite you
snap.translation[0].definitions[4].examp: The dog started snapping at my heels.
snap.translation[0].definitions[5].examp: Dave snapped a picture of me and Sonia.
snap.translation[0].definitions[6].defin: to end a series of events – used especially in newspapers
snap.translation[0].definitions[6].examp: The Rockets snapped a seven-game losing streak by beating Portland.
snap.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: a sudden loud sound, especially made by something breaking or closing
snap.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: He shut the book with a snap.
snap.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: a photograph taken quickly and often not very skilfully
snap.translation[1].definitions[2].defin: a small metal fastener on clothes that works when you press its two parts together
snap.translation[1].definitions[3].defin: a card game in which players put down one card after another and try to be the first to shout ‘Snap!’ when there are two cards that are the same
snap.translation[3].definitions[0].defin: used when you see two things that are exactly the same
snap.translation[3].definitions[0].examp: Hey, snap! My hat’s the same as yours.
snap.translation[3].definitions[1].defin: said in the game of snap when two cards that are the same are put down
